jade.core
Class World

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.Messenger
      jade.core.World
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public abstract class World
extends Messenger
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is a 2D grid based world in which jade actors live. Each tile in the grid has an appearance and can hold actors. Through the tick method, the world's behavior is controled. Most likely, the tick method will call the act method on the appropriate actors.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

World

public World(int width,
             int height)
Constructs a new world with the specified size. This size is immutable once the world is created.

Parameters:
width - the width of the world
height - the height of the world
Method Detail

tick

public abstract void tick()
Specifies the behavior of the world

addActor

public void addActor(Actor actor,
                     int x,
                     int y)
Adds an actor on the world at the specified location. The actors world will be set to this world. Also, any actors attached to the actor will also be added to this world.

Parameters:
actor - the actor to be added
x - the x-coordinate where the actor will be placed
y - the x-coordinate where the actor will be placed

addActor

public void addActor(Actor actor,
                     Coord coord)
Adds an actor on the world at the specified location. The actors world will be set to this world. Also, any actors attached to the actor will also be added to this world.

Parameters:
actor - the actor to be added
coord - the coordinate where the actor will be placed

addActor

public void addActor(Actor actor,
                     java.util.Random random)
Adds an actor to a random, open tile. A tile is open if there are no actors on the tile and the tile is passable.

Parameters:
actor - the actor to be added
random - the psuedorandom number generator to be used in selecting the open tile

getActorAt

public <T extends Actor> T getActorAt(int x,
                                      int y,
                                      java.lang.Class<T> cls)
Returns one actor of the specified class from the given location, or null if none is found. The return type of this method will be the class passed into the method. If there are more than one actor of the specified class at the location, there is no guarantee as to which one will be returned.

Type Parameters:
T - extends Actor. Is the return type.
Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate to search at
y - the y-coordinate to search at
cls - determins T
Returns:
one actor of the specified class from the given location, or null if none is found.

getActorsAt

public <T extends Actor> java.util.Collection<T> getActorsAt(int x,
                                                             int y,
                                                             java.lang.Class<T> cls)
Returns a collection with all the actors of the specified class at a location. The collection will be parameterized based on the given class.

Type Parameters:
T - extends Actor. Collection will be the return type.
Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate to search at
y - the y-coordinate to search at
cls - determins T
Returns:
a collection with all the actors of the specified class at the given location

getActors

public <T extends Actor> java.util.Collection<T> getActors(java.lang.Class<T> cls)
Returns a collection of all actors of the specified class currently on the world. The collection will be parameterized on the given class.

Type Parameters:
T - extends Actor. Collection will be the return type
Parameters:
cls - determins T
Returns:
a collection of all actors of the specified class currently on the world.

removeActor

public void removeActor(Actor actor)
Removes an actor, all with all actors that are attached to it from the world. The actor must belong to this world.

Parameters:
actor - the actor to remove

removeExpired

public void removeExpired()
Removes all expired actors from the world. In most cases, this method should be called somewhere in the tick method so that expired actors are removed in a timely manner.

                 int y)

y - the y-coordinate of the tile to be returned

Parameters:

getOpenTile

public Coord getOpenTile(java.util.Random random)
Returns a random open tile on the world. A tile is open if it is passable and there are no actors on it.

Parameters:
random - the psuedorandom number generator to be used in finding the open tile
Returns:
a random open tile on the world

look

public ColoredChar look(int x,
                        int y)
Returns the appearance of the specified tile. By default this method returns the appearance of the tile itself, but could be overriden to return the look method of the actors on the tile.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the tile
y - the y-coordinate of the tile
Returns:
the appearance of the specified tile

look

public ColoredChar look(Coord coord)
Returns the appearance of the specified tile. By default this method returns the appearance of the tile itself, but could be overriden to return the look method of the actors on the tile.

Parameters:
coord - the coordinate location of the tile
Returns:
the appearance of the specified tile

passable

public boolean passable(int x,
                        int y)
Returns true if the specified tile is passable, false otherwise. By default, this method only examins the passable property of the tile, but could be overriden to consider the presence of actors.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the tile
y - the y-coordinate of the tile
Returns:
true if the specified tile is passable, false otherwise

passable

public boolean passable(Coord coord)
Returns true if the specified tile is passable, false otherwise. By default, this method only examins the passable property of the tile, but could be overriden to consider the presence of actors.

Parameters:
coord - the coordinate location of the tile
Returns:
true if the specified tile is passable, false otherwise
